attributes.comment:
I am astonished to learn that the USCIS fees for adoption and related forms are
AGAIN being increased, and significantly so. We have adopted 5 times from
Eastern Europe and the costs are already overwhelming. We have paid so many
I600 fees, visa fees, fingerprint fees etc. (and WHY do fingerprints expire
anyway?)

We have a daughter who entered the country after the automatic citizenship law
went into effect but before the certificates of citizenship became automatic.
(July 2003). Beginning in about January 2004, certificates started being sent
automatically about 6 weeks after the child entered the US on an IR3 visa (as
our daughter did). We were told by BCIS that the certificates for adoptions
during 2003 would be "caught up" the certificates would come about a year later.
Of course, it has not come for over 3 years. She will be 18 this year and we
are going to have to pay a fee for a certificate that we were promised would
come automatically!!!!! That fee is now $255 and is proposed to go up to $460.
We already paid for her IR3 Visa, and she IS a citizen! Children we adopted in
2005 got their certificate automatically, but our other daughter did not..

So, a system that is not doing what it is supposed to be doing is now going to
start charging more to NOT do it? Bureaucracy at it's finest.

Comment on FR Doc #
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Karen Hauber
